hints.text: You can work on WTF part 1 and part 2 independently, but you'll need both parts to get the final answer. If you've never seen these logic puzzles before, checkout nikoli.com.

The logic puzzles don't form a cohesive picture, just a pattern of boxes in white, grey and blue.  It should look kind of familiar, however.  You can verify any row in any logic puzzle by entering it into the app, by digit for the Filomino, by color (g, w or b) for the Nonogram and the Inverse Akari and by fill (m, t or n) for Minesweeper+.
WTF: What the F*(&, the phrases are in alphabetic order.
Match the logic puzzle grids from Who To Follow to the grid in What the F*(&, the dark blue squares should give you path through the grid with a message that starts with "THE ANSWER IS"
